image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Minnesota; born in Minneapolis, Hennepin County, Minn., July 12, 1922; graduated from Washburn High School, Minneapolis, Minn.; A.B., Dartmouth College, Hanover, N.H., 1946; LL.B., University of Minnesota Law School, 1948; United States Army, Office of Strategic Services, 1942-1945; lawyer, private practice; delegate, Republican National Conventions, 1964 and 1968; elected as a Republican to the Eighty-seventh and to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1961-January 3, 1971); not a candidate for reelection to the Ninety-second Congress in 1970, but was an unsuccessful nominee to the United States Senate; business executive; died on February 10, 2003, in Pompano Beach, Fla.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: MacGregor, Clark. "Human Relations: The Challenge of Today and Tomorrow." In Republican Paper, edited by Melvin R. Laird, pp. 245-52. New York: Praeger, 1968.

researchRecord.name: 1970, 1 commercial on 1 film reel.
researchRecord.description: The commercial was used during Clark MacGregor's campaign for the 1970 U.S. senatorial election in Minnesota, Republican Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication

researchRecord.name: 1958-1972, 46 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The papers of Clark MacGregor contain congressional office files and campaign files, with some earlier and later reference files, photographs, sound recordings, and miscellany. Topics documented in the papers include civil rights, government ethics, urban problems, and crime control. An unpublished finding aid in is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: In the Excelsior Fruit Growers Association Records, 1900-1969, 5 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Other authors include Clark MacGregor. An inventory for the papers is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: In the Louis Edward Lerman Papers, ca. 1917-1978, 11 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Other authors include Clark MacGregor. An inventory for the papers is available in the repository.
